# SKOverlay.TransitionContext

**Class**

A context object you can use to animate UI changes while the platform presents or dismisses an overlay.

## Declaration

```swift
class TransitionContext
```

## Overview

For more information on animating UI changes while the system presents or dismisses an overlay, see [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/SKOverlayDelegate/storeOverlayWillStartPresentation(_:transitionContext:)] and [doc://com.apple.storekit/documentation/StoreKit/SKOverlayDelegate/storeOverlayWillStartDismissal(_:transitionContext:)].

## Adding an Animation

- **addAnimation(_:)**: Adds a closure you can use to animate view properties.
- **startFrame**: The size and location of the overlay before the transition.
- **endFrame**: The size and location of the overlay at the end of the transition.

## Responding to the Overlay’s Appearance and Disappearance

- **storeOverlayWillStartPresentation(_:transitionContext:)**: Indicates that the platform presents an overlay.
- **storeOverlayDidFinishPresentation(_:transitionContext:)**: Indicates that the platform finished presenting an overlay.
- **storeOverlayWillStartDismissal(_:transitionContext:)**: Indicates that the platform dismisses an overlay.
- **storeOverlayDidFinishDismissal(_:transitionContext:)**: Indicates that platform finished dismissing an overlay.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
